meanings.definition: Allow the existence, occurrence, or practice of (something that one dislikes or disagrees with) without interference.
meanings.sent1: She tolerates her brother's loud music even though it bothers her.
meanings.sent2: The teacher tolerates students asking questions during class.
meanings.sent3: He tolerates the noisy neighbors by wearing earplugs.
meanings.sent4: The old tree tolerates the harsh winter winds year after year.
meanings.sent5: The cat tolerates the playful puppy's antics in the house.

meanings.definition: Endure (someone or something unpleasant) with forbearance.
meanings.sent1: He tolerates the long wait at the doctor's office without complaining.
meanings.sent2: She tolerates the bitter taste of the medicine to get better.
meanings.sent3: The hiker tolerates the pesky mosquitoes buzzing around.
meanings.sent4: The athlete tolerates the pain of training to improve performance.
meanings.sent5: The farmer tolerates the hot sun while working in the fields.
